statement.p: The expected temperature at a height above ground is given by
where \displaystyle{T}_{{A}} is the expected temperature in Fahrenheit
\displaystyle{T}_{{G}} is the temperature at ground level in Fahrenheit
\displaystyle{A} is the height above ground level in feet
If the temperature on the ground is \displaystyle{69}^{\circ}, what will it be at 3300 feet above ground level?
Answers should be rounded to the units place.

solution.p: The model for this situation is \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={69}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{A}.
Because we want to estimate the temperature at 3300 ft AGL, we calculate \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={69}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{3300}={57.45}\approx{57}
